title: Introducing: Carnivore Club
content:
It’s a grossly exaggerated and perhaps mindbogglingly ignorant statement, but for the most part, I hate folk music.

Especially anything with a ukelele or a banjo. Carnivore Club, the solo-project of Arend Bruchwitz (also of Judas And The Winehearts), labels his own music as ‘folk’, yet there’s a far more hard-hitting, in your face nature to it, that he recognises himself – “Sometimes intimate and delicate, sometimes urgent and towering, yet always melodic and warm, his music sounds like it has been thrown in a cauldron of bittersweet nostalgia.” With his debut release, a five track, self-titled EP, he runs through emotional minefields (Fire Song) and straight up, catchy, Vampire Weekend-esque numbers (Push It, It’ll Go). There’s a composure and poignancy to Carnivore Club, that is quite unlike any other new artist I’ve heard this year; stream the full release below.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
